me.lihq.game.people

Class AbstractPerson

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion
      • com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite
        • me.lihq.game.people.AbstractPerson
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    NPC, Player

    public abstract class AbstractPerson
extends com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite
    The abstract person is an abstract representation of a person. A person can be a non playable character or Player. It extends the sprite class which provides methods for the person to be rendered in the game.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AbstractPerson.Direction
      This is used to describe the direction the person is currently facing or moving in.
      static class  AbstractPerson.Personality
      This is the possible personalities of the persond
      static class  AbstractPerson.PersonPositionComparator 
      static class  AbstractPerson.PersonState
      The state of the person explains what they are currently doing.

      protected Vector2Int tileCoordinates
      This is the location of the person in the room in terms of tiles eg (0,0) would be the bottom left of the room Uses the Vector2Int as the tileCoordinates should never be floats as the person should only be between tiles during the move process.

    • Field Detail

      • SPRITE_HEIGHT

        protected static int SPRITE_HEIGHT
        The height of the texture region for each person

      • SPRITE_WIDTH

        protected static int SPRITE_WIDTH
        The width of the texture region for each person

      • tileCoordinates

        protected Vector2Int tileCoordinates
        This is the location of the person in the room in terms of tiles eg (0,0) would be the bottom left of the room Uses the Vector2Int as the tileCoordinates should never be floats as the person should only be between tiles during the move process.

      • coordinates

        protected com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 coordinates
        This is the players location in the current room. Note this is different to sprite position, the sprite position is the location that the person is currently drawn. Avoid using Sprites setPosition as if it is changed mid render it will cause jolting.

      • startTile

        protected Vector2Int startTile
        A store of the starting point for a movement.

      • destinationTile

        protected Vector2Int destinationTile
        A store of the destination for a movement.

        The direction determines the way the character is facing.

      • state

        protected AbstractPerson.PersonState state

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove
        This is whether the NPC can move or not. It is mainly used to not let them move during converstation

    • Method Detail

      • pushCoordinatesToSprite

        public void pushCoordinatesToSprite()
        This method moves the coordinates in the AbstractPersons coordinates to the Sprites position so that it can then be rendered at the correct location.

      • getState

        public AbstractPerson.PersonState getState()
        This method returns the Persons walking state.

        Either WALKING or STANDING

      • setTileCoordinates

        public void setTileCoordinates(int x,
                               int y)
        This sets the tile coordinates of the person.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the tile grid.
        y - The y coordinate of the tile grid.

      • update

        public void update()
        This is called to update the players position. Called from the game loop, it interpolates the movement so that the person moves smoothly from tile to tile.

      • initialiseMove

        public void initialiseMove(AbstractPerson.Direction dir)
        Sets up the move, initialising the start position and destination as well as the state of the person. This allows the movement to be smooth and fluid.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction that the person is moving in.

      • finishMove

        public void finishMove()
        Finalises the move by resetting the animation timer and setting the state back to standing. Called when the player is no longer moving.
